text: Bottle. It pours hazy golden with a white head. The aroma is spicy berries, sour bitter fruit and tropical fruit. The flavor is acidic and spicy berries with tropical and citrusy notes. Grapefruit and passion fruit. Woody notes.
Bottle. Aroma of citrus, lactic, barnyard, tropical and grapefuit. Wooden notes. Mainly sour; tart - but finish light bitter fruityness. Light and juicy. Lively carbonation. A good one.

URUS 3.0
Aroma: lemon, hoppy citrus, pineapple, leather, light barnyard
Taste: medium sour, tart, lemon, pineapple, grassy, leather
Pite na Urusie. Bretty, stajnia ale bez ekstremy, cytrusy i gdzieś tam winogrona. Naprawdę najs piwo.

375 ml bottle into tulip glass, bottled on 10/26/2016. Pours slightly hazy pale golden/straw color with a 2 finger fairly dense and fluffy white head with good retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings on the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of big tart lemon, lime, tangerine, grapefruit, pineapple, peach, guava, passion fruit, papaya, mango, melon, pear, green apple, citrus peel, white wine, pepper, oak, wheat, cracker, hay, straw, grass, light leather/musty funk, and yeast earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of fruity/funky/acidic yeast, citrus/tropical hops, wine barrel, and moderate pale malt notes; with great strength. Taste of big tart lemon, lime, tangerine, grapefruit, pineapple, peach, guava, passion fruit, papaya, mango, melon, pear, green apple, citrus peel, white wine, pepper, oak, wheat, cracker, hay, straw, grass, light leather/musty funk, and yeast earthiness. Light-moderate lactic tartness and yeast/oak spiciness on the finish. Lingering notes of tart lemon, lime, tangerine, grapefruit, pineapple, peach, guava, passion fruit, papaya, mango, melon, pear, green apple, citrus peel, white wine, pepper, oak, wheat, cracker, hay, straw, grass, light leather/musty funk, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Fantastic complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/funky/acidic yeast, citrus/tropical hops, wine barrel, and moderate pale malt flavors; with an awesome malt/tart/spiciness balance; and zero puckering flavors after the finish. Light-moderate dryness from tart/spiciness, increasing through the glass. Medium carbonation and light-medium body; with a very smooth, moderately grainy/acidic, fairly crisp, and lightly tannic balanced mouthfeel that is great. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 6.8%. Overall this is a fantastic dry hopped sour/wild ale! All around outstanding complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/funky/acidic yeast, citrus/tropical hops, wine barrel, and moderate pale malt flavors; very smooth, crisp, and easy to drink with the balanced acidic/tannic finish. A perfectly balanced showcase of Brett, Lacto, and Citra hops; with great wine barrel presence. A highly enjoyable offering.

A 375ml bottle, as Almanac Citra Sour, bottled in July 2015. Poured into a Lost Abbey teku. It was a nice hazy golden orange colour with a two finger white head that dissipated fairly quickly while leaving some nice sticky lacing. Aromas were of tropical fruit, mango and pineapple followed by citrusy mandarin, orange rind and grapefruit with hints of funkiness. Tastes similar to the aroma as its funky, tart, sour, tropical, mango, passionfruit and apricot, followed by citrusy mandarin and orange rind with light oak. Medium bodied with moderate to high carbonation. Overall very nice and refreshing tropical and citrus aromas and flavours with matching funk. The barrel notes were a bit weak, but Im perfectly fine with that in this case.
From bottle in tulip. Pours with hazy golden hue and strong citrus hop aroma as expected. Forward tartness with refreshing fruity taste of citrus and melon. A palate cleanser.

Bottle shared @Pułapka, Gdańsk
Very hoppy Citra aroma, tart fruity scents. Under the hoppy front some nice brett scents. Taste is sour, acetic, white fruit & nice sour fin

375, capped. Pours a cloudy medium bright orange with a dense and creamy tan head that sticks around for a minute. Bright tangy grapefruit nose, showing juicy and dry rind-y notes. Creamy medium body with lively carb. Lightly sweetened cereal under a bunch of juicy grapefruit and dry grapefruit rind on the mid palate. Tart ferment notes blend right in to the hop notes cohesively. Crisp dry finish.

Bouteille achetée à La Mise En Bière - De couleur dorée limpide avec une belle mousse blanche abondante - Au nez des arômes vineux et boisé se marie au agrumes du houblon, raisin, chêne, citron, pamplemousse, mandarine, résineux, très peux de place pour le malt, on sent tout de suite lacidité, un nez incroyable - En bouche ca continue, bonne acidité, on retrouve vite la présence du fut, vineux, vin blanc, cidre, citron, pamplemousse, ananas, légèrement résineuse et herbacee, il y a encor beaucoup de chose ca dire mais je vous laisse déguster - Corp léger, amertume moyenne, carbonation pétillante, acide et sèche, final citroné sec - Magnifique bière, complexe, rafraîchissante, bonne acidité bien équilibrée par le fut et les houblons

Juicy and tropical - I basically loved everything about this. Blonde-light orange color. This brew had touches of bright vinous fruit, a tart finishing dryness, and some mild oakiness - all of which would make it a solid white wine substitute for meal pairings. Fruity (stone fruit and melon) and herbaceous flavors. This is a Sour for the insufferable IPA fanatic (me).
Bright yellow with a frothy off white head and good lacing. Aromas pungent, tart, citrus, bit of funk. Flavors like nose, hint of salt, mint in the finish. Not much sign of hops. Nice finish.

Taproom draft into a shot-glass showing lightly filtered hazy dark orange with white foam lacing. 

The nose shows juicy pineapple and citrus balanced by light mango in the middle and a very light malty bed. 

The palate is moderately carbonated and light bodied. Lightly tart with citric hop forwardness and flavors of dry pineapple and a very light hoppy bitterness on the finish. Drinks like a cross of a sour ale and pale ale. Nice
375ml bottle. Pours a little cloudy and brilliant gold. Lemon, pepper, flowers, melon, white wine vinegar, peach. Big, bold, spicy. Extremely tart. Well carbonated with a good full body. Fantastic.

Bottle.

A- Tart, subtle garlic, citrus, funky, barnyard.

A- Yellow color, cloudy liquid, white head.

T- Sour, funky, citrus, acidic.

P- Medium body, average texture, average carbonation, funky finish.

O- Wasnt sure what to expect here. Didnt get much for hoppy bitterness, but plenty of funky and citrus. Not bad.

Cloudy yellow with very active head that thins quickly. Small bubbles. Smells exactly like a handful of fresh lychees. Bit of sourness there too, but a fruity sourness. Taste is much more sour, real lip puckerer. Summer fruits as well, mangoes, passionfruit and lychee. Aromatic, piney hops. Not overly bitter. Very light on the palate for a 7%, sourness lingers but not too strongly.

[1/25/17] Draught at Almanac Taproom in San Francisco. Cloudy yellow. Great sour fruity hops aroma with some oak. Tart flavor, juicy, with lots of fruity hops, and oak. Great stuff, really refreshing.
(Bootle) very hazy yellow colour with a small white head; aroma starts with tropical fruit, then funk, then jam; smooth palate; sour flavour with a medium long, medium sour finish; very pleasant
Lots of sweet citra (ripe tropical fruit, lychee), light funk (ripe fruit), medium mostly lactic (+ fresh acetic) sourness, superb interplay between fruity hops, acids and funk.

Draft. Hazed golden pour. Very clean sourness, mint and melon citra hops, lots of citrus tartness. Its good but not worth the price, plenty of other breweries that are abole to put kettle sours in reasonably-priced 6 packs, theres no oak to this....

Bottle. Sensoric. Golden,medium hazy with moderate, semi-thick, off-white head. Poor head retention and lacing. Aroma is moderately malty and modertatelu sour - stable, constant. Moderate citrus, tart, yeasty, fruity (tropical fruits) and crisp. Nice moderate white wine BA notes, which are quite complimentary to each other. Medium body, oily to watery texture, average to lively carbonation, finish is crisp, citrus and refreshing. In overall nice, drinkable, sour ale with quite strong, but short white wine BA accents.
Good citra hopping, good sour. Bottle at Birreria Volo. Very drinkable. I like the sour finish. A little head retention.
Aromas of horse blanket, grapefruit, and lemon zest. Taste is lemon juice, grapefruit peel, clementine, hay, funk, and a touch of oak barrel. A nice light cracker malt and floral hops finish it off.
Bottle. Yellow-golden colour with white head. Lemon, citric aroma. Citric, lemon, grass, acidic, sour taste. Medium body.
Good sour blond base adding some tartness. Hoppy pear and melon flavors. Cloudy golden color.

UPDATED: MAY 4, 2017 On [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ golden color, slightly haze with foamy white head. Aroma-flavor: intense hop aroma which takes on pine, citruses, some funk, grapes, leather, with bitter, slightly tart, dry finish. Body is medium, texture smooth, carbonation medium.

On draft at Cultivate. The pour is a foggy golden yellow with a thick head of white foam that falls down to a film and thick ring. There is a little lace in its wake. The aroma is nice. There is definitely a sour citrus. Its lightly grainy and a little hoppy, but the sour citrus is there. The flavor is good. There is a strong citra hip and a lovely sourness to it. Its not hop related, or lacto, which I like. Its a sour citrus zest. The mouth feel is light and crisp with a bitter zest and a lingering citrus sourness. Its got a little leafy hop going on, but I dig it. This is pretty damn good.

The pictured bottle is the one I had and it said 6.8% abv. Pours a clear golden yellow with bubbly white head that leaves light lace. Aroma is mild oaky funk covered by lactic acidity and tropical fruity and grassy hop notes. Taste follows, barrel is present but not overwhelming, nice lactic acidity, but the star of the show is the hops for sure. This is definitely amazing.
Sample at GABF. Pours a hazy yellow gold with medium white head that lasts. The aroma is citrus, lacto, wheat, grass. Medium body, nice tartness, citrus, grass, juicy, light acidity, very nice.

Hazy bright straw/light golden with a thin sticky white cap. Bright orange zest and lemon zesty sourness on the nose with a kiss of funk. Bright poppy flavor that begins with orange and lemon zest, a delightful tropical citric sourness, and a cool orange zest finish with a kiss of lactic tartness and is overall quite smooth, citric, tart but not too tart, and dry on the semisweet finish. Incredible.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.
375ml bottle. Pours a very murky blonde. Tart nose with a hint of the citra hidden away. Strong carbonation which brings out the fruit flavours and citra notes.
Lett tåkete gulbrun med lavt hvitt skum. Får litt såpelukt følelse, parfyme, sitrusen er der. Noe gress dukker også opp. lett sursyrlig smak, sitrus, sitron. Middels lang.

0,375l bottle at home. Bottled 07/2015. yellow hazy color, medium big white head. smells citric, parfumy, light funk, some belgian yeast, lightly acidic. nice smell. full body, bubbly carbonation, slick moutfheel. tastes citric, lightly yeasty, sour, some funk, spices, hints of wine barrel notes. finishes medium sour and lightly dry with citrus notes and some spices. good, but lacks a bit complexity. expectec a bit more.

Bottle. Golden in colour, quite clear with small white head. Aroma of tropical fruits, pineapple and citrus but also belgian peach, apricot and funk. In taste tart, sour, zesty with lacto, barnyard and grapefruit notes. Medium body, smooth and creamy mouthfeel, dry and tart finish. Very refreshing and drinkable.

Hazed golden in color with a white head. Lemony-tart with a noticeable citra hop undertone. Pretty much as described.

Notes: Atomic Liquors Sour Saturday 15

Bottle at Schouskjelleren, march 18th 2016. Hazy yellow body with a white head. Aroma is lactic with tropical fruits and yeast. Taste is sour with funk and lots of citrus fruits, zesty and dry with a crisp citra tone. The hps is really shining here together with the dry sourness. Zesty and enjoyable, a great beer.

Bottle
Aroma-lemon, vanilla, spices, seeds
Appearance-golden, hazy, white foam, 
Taste-medium sourness, lightly bitter, light sweetness, 
Palate-medium body, sticky, average carbonation, long finish, 
Overall-very good
Bottle. Clear golden yellow color, fluffy white head with good retention. Aroma of lemon and grapegruit. Taste is softly sour citrus. delicious.

375ml bottle. Golden colour, white foam head leaving some lacing and aroma of tropical fruit, peach, pineapple, lemon citrus rind, apricot, funk. Taste is tangy sour, lemon zest, orange citrus, grapefruit with juicy fruit, lactic and barnyard notes. Smooth mouthfeel, medium bodied, soft carbonation, dry sour finish. Very drinkable.

Aroma: elderflower, banana, lemonade, peach, 
Taste: crisp, lemonade, peach, fruit winegum candy

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Lemon, elderflower, light barrel notes, brett, barnyard. Hoppy more in the aroma than in the taste. More wild than sour, amazingly crisp. Excellent stuff.
Bottle, very very nice beer. Hoppy taste and aroma yet fresh as a lemonade. Really enjoyable.

Bottle 375ml. [ As Almanac Citra Sour ].Clear medium yellow color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly to fully lasting, white to off-white head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, pale malt, sweet malt, moderate hoppy, citrus, tart, moderate yeasty, sour yeast, citrusy, light barnyard. Flavor is moderate sweet and acidic with a long duration, tart, citrus, dry, grapes, citrusy, dry and crispy. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20160422]

(bottle shared with neongolden) pours very hazy pale yellow gold, foamy white head. Really nicely balanced sweet, tart, dank aroma - tropical fruit, candied peach, pineapple, mango, apples, grapefruit. Really love the aroma. Palate is less bright and fruity than the nose suggests; quite dry, sour, tart, lactic, yogurty, citrus peel, apples, passionfruit, light bitterness.

(375ml July 2015 bottle from boxbeers.dk) Pours very hazy pale gold with a small persistent head of fine white bubbles. Nose is pungent, big and fruit-driven but complex. Lots of candied or dried fruits in particular - peaches, pineapple, papaya, mango, passion fruit, grapefruit juice, skunky weed, cat pee, a bit of musty horsey funk, tart and lactic, a little sweet pale malt. Palate doesnt quite live up to the nose, lactic lemon yoghurt tartness, light biscuit malt, citrus peel, underripe passion fruit, pith, fruit skins. Un-ripe apple in the finish, puckering lactic yoghurt feel, dry, a touch mineral. Medium body, high and effervescent carbonation. The nose on this is really something. The palate is not nearly so bright, but its still a very nice sour.
Bottle. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are citrus, lactose acid, passionfruit, malt and has a nice sour finish.
Bottle. Creamy white good mostly lasting head. Yellow colour. Light malty and heavy hoppy aroma. nice sour notes. Heavy bitter flavor. Nice sour notes. long finsh. Creamy palate.

Bottle @ Aarhus tasting. Hazy golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, fruity, barnyard and moderate hoppy - fruity. Flavor is quite sweet, moderate bitter and moderate acidic. Dry, moderate bitter and moderate acidic finish. 220416

Bottle, 7%. citrusdark yellow with medium off-white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, lacto, citris, lemon, tropical fruit and pineapple. Flavour is malt, fruit, hops, tropical fruits, lemon, brett, little sour, citric, little dry, little sweet and a little bitter.

Bottle sample at Växjö Ölfestival. Cloudy golden with white head. Aroma is hoppy and sour, citrus, lemon, lactic, grapes and slight barrel notes. Taste is similar and adds flowers, grass, funky barnyard notes and musty fruit notes. Good

Hazy yellow color with white head. Aroma has lemony tartness and citrusy hops. Taste is also tart and lemony with some citrusy and slightly dank hops on top. Slightly bitter on the finish. Medium body and carbonation, quite dry aftertaste. A nice hoppy sour, just not as special as I expected.

Bottle. Cloudy golden body with white head. Aroma is wonderful citrus with slight barnyard and funk and sour fruits. Taste is lemon,fruits, bretts and some grapes. Aftertaste is very nice balanced between sweetness, sourness and hops bitterness. Very nice one.

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; hazy golden yellow pour with a creamy white head, aroma has pissy Citra along with some light funky manoeuvres, taste has brett action, pissy, grapefruit, lemon, a hint of wood, great.

0.375l bottle. Looks pretty good this. It has a cloudy strawish yellow golden color in the glass with a medium sized really side clinging and dotting on the glass side white head. Love the aroma. Its definitely hoppy fruity with that amazing Citra touch. Citrussy and sweet, I get peaches and lemon zest. A little bit of blood oranges also in this wonderful blend. Smells superb. And the taste definitely lives up to the aroma. Really refreshing and citrus infused this. Not directly sour but it has a lively acidity all the way. It has a good oily texture in the mouth and its just about average on the carbonation. I also get a nice almost sweet white wine tone dancing in the back. A hint of grains and some soft earthy wet leafs is really the only thing dragging the whole experience a bit down, but its undoubtedly a lovely one this. 01.04.2016

On bottle at Sandar Bryghus. Pale hazy golden color- some foam. Medium/ high aroma intensity ; immediate stable & hops , fruitiness, citrus - significant yeast impact . Good sourness, balances well. Very Enjoyable 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours hazy yellow, with a creamy head. Aroma is tart citrusy hops, white berries, grapes and wooden brett, as well as some musty floral, tropical and farmyard notes. Medium to full body, with soft carbonation. Flavour is tart citrusy hops, with bretty wood, some musty fruits, berries and grapes. Nice and drinkable, and quite straight forward.

Draught @ Mig og Ølsnedkeren, Aarhus. Pours slightly hazy yellow with an small offwhite head. Aroma of sourness, malt, grass, fruity hops, peach, mango, pineapple, citrus, cats piss. Flavor is sour, malt, fresh fruity hops, citrus. Medium body, average carbonation, light acidic finish. 190316

Hazy yellow with a white wild head that went away fast. Aroma is zest, lemon juicy, grape, some slight funk. Tart and fruity on the tongue, almost juice like. Medium carbonation, sour finish, splendid stuff
Bottle at Hoarders Society Meeting Odense. Unclear yellow body with a small white head. Citra, pepper notes, passion fruit, juicy, pineapple, tart. Clean, delicious.

From bottle @ Hoarders Society Meeting Odense. Pours hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma of citra hops, sour, tropical, juicy, one-dimensional nose. Taste is light stomach acid, lots of hops, citrus fruit sourness, a bit unclean, IMO... I have no idea what you guys are tasting, but this is not as good as you say it is.
Bottle. Pours hazy yellow with a White head. Aroma of tropical hops, tart, latic acid, grape, funky, juicy. Taste is tarty, sour, tropical, not that complex, but very well made. Just keep This up.
Bottle @ Odense Hoarder Society Meeting, 2016. Pours hazy yellow with a small white head. Funk, citra, barnyard and wood. Dry and crisp. Lovely!

375ml bottle from shop.mikkeller.dk


Deep pale yellow colour with a small white head. Tart, fruity, vinous and delicious!

Keg at BD Soho. It pours hazy orange - amber with a thick off - white head. The aroma is fresh, bitter - sweet, funky, tropical fruit punch, papaya, nectarine, melon, mango, must, earth and hay. The taste is crisp, tart, juicy, sour orange, nectarine, grapefruit, sherbet, some acidity, tropical fruit, earthy, funky, fairly bracing acidity, pine and straw with a lingering dry - tart finish. Medium body and fine carbonation. Pretty punchy and flavoursome. Tasty.

05.03.2016, 0,375l bottle @ home:
Nice creamy mediumlasting head, slightly hazy. Aroma is sour-ish fresh, leafs, citrus peel, grass, weeds, fresh hops, soda powder, light malts, oak, hay, alcohol, citrus acid. Taste is sour-ish dry, citrus acid, soda powder, citrus peel, grass, hay, weeds, minerals, grapefruit, unripe nectarine, fresh hops, hints of yuzu. Medium bitterness, mild acidic mouthfeel. Nice one.

Bottle. light hazy hay yellow liquid with medium to big off-white head. Aroma of citrus, tangerine, lemon peel, fresh hops, mango, pineapple, apples, apple skin, mineral, grapefruit, light barnyard, hay, horse blanket and light grain. Extremely effervescent. The hoppy aroma just jumped at me upon opening the bottle. Taste is dry and medium sour with notes of tangerine, grapefruit pith, fresh hops, lemon, lemon peel, light grain and apple skin. Medium bodied with medium to high carbonation. This is spectacular. Aroma is insane. So well executed.
From tap. Hazy yellow colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of citrus, hops, crispy and tartness.

Pours milky yellow with low white head
Aromas tart, citrusy, lemon grass, sour green apples, passion fruit
Taste has lovely tart citrusy fruityness, lemongrass, passion fruits, slight spicy and floral, sour grapes. Brilliant!
Medium to high carbonation, medium tartness, low sweetness and bitterness, medium bodied
Almanac tap takeover at PreFunk Nampa hazy yellow light beige. Lots of fruity citrusy hop flavors blend well with the sour Blonde base. Works well and its very tart and refreshing.

Thanks to the mad scientist for sharing. Hazy yellow body with a small white cap. Sunshine, wheat, hops, citrus aroma. Funky character. Mild sourness. Grapefruit, orange, perhaps a touch of kiwi. Easy drinking and nice.

Bottle at home. Clear yellow - white head. Nice citric, sour. Herbal. Herbal sourish. Light green notes. Light malty. Sweet melon. Grape fruity notes. Fruity wooden notes. Light tannins.. Nice high fruity - with a sour bite - and some freshness....

Bottle. Pours milky yellow with a small white head. Aromas of lactic sourness, citra, coriander, lemony, oaky, apricots. Taste has lots of citra, grapes, citrus, lemon zest, lactic sourness, stone fruits.

Pours cloudy apricot with a large frothy white head. Aromas of lemon, funk, farmhouse, cloudberry, oak, white wine. Taste is tart and fruity. Mouthfeel is dry and tart with medium carbonation. Very very good. Ridiculously well balanced.

Aromais a delicious sourcitrus, light sweetness. Paleyellow hazy beer. Taste islight sweetness, lightly bitter, medium sourness.light body, thin feel, soft carbonation, short finish. Abit too thin in bodyand taste, aroma is excellent.
Bottle from el cerrito, california. Yellow color, white head. Aroma has sour fruity notes, pineapples, some wine notes. Medium body, fruity, mango, citrus notes. Little bit light bodied.

Bottled. Pours hazy pale golden with a small white head. Aroma of citrus, peach, tropical fruits and funky notes. Slightly sweet flavor that ends up dry, tart and bitter. Meddium bodied, watery to oily texture and soft carbonation. An excellent hoppy Sour. 🌟🌟🌟🌟

Bottle @ Dangerous bottleshares #18 . Pours hazy golden/yellow with a white head. Aroma has lots and lots of fresh citra hops which brings you notes of passion fruit, mango, peach and orange. Also some tart lactic stuff but overall juicy and fly! The taste is hoppy and tart with notes of tropical citrus fruits, lemon peel and weak vinegar. This is what you want if you want a juicy sour to spice up your life (or wife) .
Bottle at Dangerous Bottleshares #18. HAzy golden pour with a tiny head. Notes of pickles, grapes and onions on the nose. Taste has grapefruit, biscuits, pickles, grapes and a pleasant funk.
Bottle. Amber beer with a whitish head. Nice grapefruit aroma with citrus. Sour and lemon flavor with grapefruit. Medium bodied. Grapefruit and lemon lingers with sourness.
Bottle. Pours a hazy yellow color with a small white head. Has a fruity sour tart citrus hoppy woody aroma. Fruity sour tart woody hoppy citrus flavor. Has a fruity sour tart citrus finish.

Bottle at Dangerous Bottleshares #18. Pours a murky orange/yellow with a small, white head. Aroma has lots of passion fruit, fruity hops, lots of fruit juice, lactic sour notes, lemon, wheat, grapefruit. Taste is sour, juicy, fruity, white grapes, lactic, light taste overall, hoppy, light bitter finish. Light and crisp body, high carbonation.

At first seemed like "just another boring sour" that works well for boosting aroma of another beers or between another beers, but at some point I felt in love with this brew as citrusy sourness becomed to
very lively refreshing ripe lemon in bath of very fresh floral hops. After some another sips I felt like in summer :) Distinct sourness, light sweetness and light bitterness in finish. Nice!

Nice one, medium malty sourness so well goes with kind of fresh hop cones flavor, to me it was less citrusy than hops greenish, freshness. Pours misty deep yellow with thick, rocky white top. Good lasing. Body- above average. Light bitterness.
Yellow with medium white head. Sweet fruity aroma. Sour taste with balancing sweetness, kind of good lemon juice. Other sweet fruity notes, some bitterness comes later.
37.5 cl bottle. Pours hazy yellow with a small white head. Aroma is citrusy, fruity and crisp hoppy. Smooth fruity, crisp citrusy, dry. Solid citrusyand lingering fruity finish.

Bottle courtesy of rlgk. Pours hazy yellow with a frothy white head that leaves some sticky trace on the glass while dissipating. Smell is fruity with crackers, lemon juice, grapefruit juice, passion fruit, lychee, kumquats, freshly cut grass, pine needles, minerals and lemon zest. Taste is sour, fruity and slightly grassy. Mouthfeel is oily, dry, tart and medium bodied. Finish is sour with crackers, lemon juice, grapefruit juice, passion fruit, lychee, kumquats, freshly cut grass, pine needles, minerals and lemon zest. Balanced tasty hoppy sour!

December 29, 2015. Bottle, shared by rlgk, thanks!

Hazy yellow with a tiny white head. Aroma is fruity and funky with lime, ripe pineapple, mango, tangerine, some barnyard.

Taste is light fruity and sour. Finish is sour citrusy, very light tropical sweetness, some funky notes, barnyard and hay.
Light to medium bodied, dry texture , average carbonation.


 Very nice balance between the tropical fruity sweetness and the sourness.

Pours golden with a white head. Aroma; Loads of citra hops, tangerine, pine, mango, grapefruit and lemon and yeast. Sour with flavours of lemon, orange, lime, mango, tangerine, some peach with a sour and semi dry finish.

Bottle at a Gothenburg tasting in our apartment 151229. Hazy golden/yellow beer with a nice offwhite head. Sourish earthy barnyard aroma, citrus, pine, leather, yeasty, peach, grape notes. Sourish hop flavor, peach, passion fruit, citrus, pine apples, earthy, hay, yeast notes, some barnyard. Fresh and complex, totally amazing.
A: Light yellow, thin white lacing. N: Hay, grapefruit, gooseberry T: peach, honeydew, passionfruit O: Amazing tropical flavours! Great balance between sour and hops. Great beer!
bottle at Rogue Brewing. Great stuff. Your typical almanac base, with good tartness and wheat flavors throughout. Then the papaya and mango flavors from citra. Awesome stuff
Pours a cloudy golden yellow with fluffy head. Aromas of citrus, hops, yeast, and some funk. Flavors of sour fruit, funk, and some nice citrus notes.

Bottle at James for cider and Big Alice night. Pours a hazed gold with a thin white head. Big dusty citrus and hops on the nose, musk and funk. Medium bodied, citrus and a touch of funk and musk. Slow musk and dusty citrus into the finish.

375 mL bottle. Cloudy gold with a small white head. Aroma is full of tangerine, tart lemon, light dank notes, star fruit, and peaches. Taste is of tart oranges, lemon, peach skin, mango, hay and dank hops.

Smell nice, super tangerine, fruit, pink grapefruit, mango, papaya, dry hopped, and powerful. The taste is much the same pretty good stuff. Big tart bold. A little haze, yellow colored, off white head.

High hopes for this one. 375ML. A clear yellow golden color with a small head that fades fast. Aroma is just sour and citra dry hopping. grapefruit, tangerine, grapes, a little bit of rye. No cat pee aroma thankfully. Sour is more tart sour grape acidity, very thin malt body and good tropical tastes.Its good but very one dimensional.
Tap at the Watering Hole. Nice. Good, citrus light sourness that fades a little later. Got the hop character, little sweetness. Nice.

Aroma: Solid Dry Citrus, Dry Rind Notes

Appearance: Hazy Golden Straw Hue, Passes Some Light, White Head, Decent Lacing

Taste: Citrus, Orange Rind Dryness, Mild Sour Mash

Mouthfeel: Decent Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Mildly Drying, Mild Tart

375 ml bottle poured into a Spiegelau tulip. Bottled July 2015. Murky yellow with around two fingers of off-white head. Aromas of floral notes, pungent barnyard funk, some white wine, toasted hay, light citrus, sort of a Brett-like note. Tastes of floral notes, lemon citrus, a little grapefruit, light tropical fruit, some white wine. Medium-light body with a dry finish. Maybe a little more funky than the Simcoe Sour.
Bottle shared at Franks (NYC) spot. Pours a light golden body with thin white lace. Nose is turpentine. Mouthfeel is soft and tart with notes of juicy tart candy, sour wheat and light fruit.

Bottle. Hazy yellows beer with a small white head. Aroma is sour with notes of citrus, barn, leather, passion fruit and tropical fruits. Flavor is sour with notes of citrus, hay, leather, passion fruit and pineapple. Well balanced.

Tap at Watering Hole. Slightly hazy gold with a small half-finger head of foam. Wonderful notes of orange zest, lemon zest, grapefruit pith passion fruit and tart citrus. Silky smooth mouthfeel with average to light carbonation. Sour on the palate but not aggressively so with wonderful balance between sour and bitter. Hides the alcohol well and really easy to drink. Finishes quite sour with some fruity, citrus fruit notes. This beer is simply what it is: Citra Sour...and that is a good thing.
Bottle. Wow, what a beer! Hazy orange pour. Big aroma and taste of citrus and some funk. Crisp, just a hint of breadiness. This is unbelievable.

Pours a light, yellowish orange hue with a small, off white head that fades quickly. Orange, lemon, passionfruit, guava on the nose. Taste is citrus, guava, strawberry, lemon with a light sourness on the back end. Medium bodied with plenty of carbonation. Really awesome beer. Another excellent one from Almanac.

This series is a winner. Golden clear color with minimal white head. Aroma is tropical fruits, light oak, vinous, lemon, and lightly grassy. Taste is nicely tart and fruity hops with a very light touch of bitter and mild sweetness.
Pours a bright gold with a thick white head. Aroma is grapefruit and a touch of funk. Taste is sour, grain, grapefruit and passion fruit. Very crisp and clean. Fantastic sour.

I had this at Global Brew. Pours gold with a white head. Taste citrus, tart, light hop. I thought this was pretty good. I would definitely drink this again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours banana yellow with aroma of lemon, grain, and tartness. Very tart flavor with mostly lemon and grain. Excellent beer.
375ml. Great to have these on the shelf in Chicago. Citric acid. Lemon. Slight sour. Lemon rind finish. The hops are faint but the fruity hops matches the citric sourness.

Almanac Citra Sour 7% 

Bottle from CBB. An opaque cloudy gold with a big fizzy with head. The nose is great, prickly pear, white pepper & possibly guanabana. The taste is very tart, wine character, pear, tons of ripe guava, acidic and tart. I loved this.

Bottle at home with Max. Hazy lemon colored with minimal off white head. Nose is citrus, dough, some lemon Brett notes. Similar on the palate with Long lemon green bitterness. This was great 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma of pine yfloral hopped goodness. Nice full mouthfeel. Flavor is tart lemon, sour patch kids, funky sour lemonade. Balanced. Palate bomb. Bottle at home. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy App

Tap at Bain, Pours hazy golden with large white head. Nose is rust and almanac butter. Flavor is overly sour lemon, sticky grapefruit stain on a counter, lactic acid, lemonade and wheat. Thin and overly acidic without depth. Not sure why people are liking this so much

Sweaty socks. Citrus aroma. Lemony. Can smell the hops in the background. Some floral aromas. Cloudy appearance. Not much for the head or lacing but expected. Strong lemon flavor. Medium carbonation. Reminds me of lemonheads. Tart finish. Bubbley mouthfeel. I sure do love the sours. Heartburn but in a good way.

500 ml bottle- Pours very hazy golden with a white crackly head that reduces leaving a thin collar. Aroma is hops up front, citrus, pine, tropical fruits reminiscent of a nice IPA, some tartness hidden in there somewhere, especially as it sits. The taste is quite the opposite, the sour holds up nicely to the dry hopping, lacto, vinegar, followed by the tropical fruity character of the citra hops, nice melange of flavors here, very nice. Body is medium and carbonation is prickly, perfect for a sour. Yummy!

375ml bottle from Blue Dog. Poured a milky straw yellow with a foamy white head.Aroma is great, white wine, barrel, loads of citrus, sour, light funk. Flavor is funky, tart, light sour patch kids, citrus fruit, light lemons, floral notes, guava and apricot. This is great.

On tap @ Beachwood BBQ. Hazed orange pour with white foam. Much more enjoyable than some of the other recent Almanac sour beers. A ton of grapefruit, grass, and floral hops. Strong lemon and yogurt sourness. Theres a nice little bit of tropical fruit such as passion fruit, too. A touch of woody herbs in there. Not too bad.
375ml bottle. Poured a hazy yellow color with a white head. Lemons, grapefruits, fruity, with some floral earthiness. Nice tart finish.

On draught at Ale Arsenal. Pours a hazy light mustard yellow with moderate head that quickly dissipates to nothing. Beautiful tart sourness and slight citrus. Moderate rich malt that balances well with the sour and hops. Delightful.

Bottle. Hazy gold. Very tart and sour in a puckery lemon lime way. Big citrus and fresh hop notes. Solid. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12.68 oz bottle. Bottled three months ago. Aroma is hoppy (cat piss, lemon rind), bretty, SweeTarts, dusty basement, lacto, wood. Pours hazy orange with a medium white head with good retention; laces some. Taste is very tart (10/10), lactic, acidic, dry, bitter, leafy green hops. Slightly foamy mouthfeel. Lip smacking good.
Bottle. Hazy gold with white head. Huge citrus notes, almost like a lemonade or limeade, extremely tart and with leafy hop notes. Light mouthfeel and strong carb. Very good.
Bottle - pours yellow white head - nose/taste of sour lemon, oak, white wine, hoppy grass, citrus - medium body

Hazy orange colored body, thin white head, minimal lacing. Tropical, pineapple juiciness, miscellaneous citrus, some fruity brett funk, light lactic notes. Medium to light bodied, moderate carbonation, bright acidity.
Bottle. Golden pour with white head. Herbal citrus hop aromas. Nice hop citrus, light herbal, nice sour and citrus tones.

A big thanks to Matt for this wonderful brew! La bière est jaune paille et affiche un mince anneau blanc en surface. Celui-ci est timide et ne laisse rien sur le verre, ce qui est quelque peu dommage car le liquide est tout simplement magnifique: trouble, non filtré, sauvage... Beaucoup de funk, darômes fermiers, du citron mais en quantité raisonnable. Léquilibre est superbement respecté entre ce houblon potentiellement agressif et ces levures qui peuvent lêtre tout autant. Attaque très surette en bouche de par ces levures sauvages puissantes, la bière demeure dune fraîcheur extrême. On sent bien le vieillissement en barriques de vin qui donne habituellement un côté gras à la bière. Ici rien de tout cela. Cest légèrement vineux mais souple, sur le raisin vert et la groseille. Finale longue et fruitée, sans arrière-goût, cette bière est un plaisir à déguster en ce vendredi après-midi demballage de cadeaux pour ma bien-aimée dont lanniversaire approche à grands pas!

Bottle. Aromas are orange juice, peaches, lemongrass, and grapefruit. Tastes moderately sour. Pulpy fruit juice mostly with moderate acidity, lemongrass, and very light funk. Im not describing it well. Its very delicious. Usually Im not a huge fan of beers that come off pulpy but the sour, tart, flavors and hops just seem to work so well in this one. Love it.

Vottle from Whole Foods PM. Pours turbid golden with frothy, white head. Nose is tart fruit juicy hops, melon, grapefruit. Tastes tart fruity, with grapefruit, some melon, mango, and that juicy Citra hop flavor. Smooth and crisp finish.

Lactic sour aroma with a lemon citrus hop finish. Taste is lactic sour, maybe 4 or 5 of 10 sour, not as sour as some almanac sours, but still significantly sour. Has a lemon citrus hop on top of the sour. Base beer is on the lighter side and has almost a Chardonnay oaky dryness. I like it, but like red wine better and darker sours, so maybe the aging in white wine barrels and the dryness from that and the dry hops compound? And almost has a bit of a Brett funk, but think it is the white wine barrels with the dry hop. Still a very good sour though. Just not as balanced as some of their others in my opinion. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Strong Danny hop aroma in the nose with a light citrus. Totally different taste. Lots of citrus, tart lemon. Really good. Way better than my rating.
Light color and fairly hazy. Sweet and tart on the nose with a hint of citrus. Great sour flavor balanced with fruity hops.

This pours a hazy straw color with a small soapy head. The aroma blast out of bottle as you crack it. You can definitely get big grapefruit notes from the Citra, but there is also a lot of winey wood notes as well. There is another funky citrus in there that I do not recognize. Quite tart flavor initially, lemony, with a big time lactic finish. This is a nice tart sour. It smells better than it tastes, but still tastes very good.
bottle i purchased in colorado .. pours a sunny yellow, hazy .. . citra, grass, sourdough, and sour wine gums .. very plucky, nice beer .. . . stompin kids is what i do, derrick!!

Draft at world of beer in Denver. Pours hazy orange with a big, fluffy white head. The aroma has all the makings of a citrus forward India pale ale.. Citrus, floral, piney. There is also a bit of the acidity present. Smells awesome. The taste has a big tartness that is balanced with a light bitterness and citrus fruit. This is a fantastically balanced sour.

375ml bottle. Citrus hop aroma with tart grapefruit and vinous sour notes. Pours cloudy golden colored with a thin white head with poor retention and lacing. Starts with grapefruity citrus flavors with a lively mouthfeel and medium body. Finishes quite sour with white wine vinous flavors with the grapefruit acidity lingering on the palate. Nice tart sour.

From shelf in upstate NY. Pour is yellow, dusty, with a large white head. Aromas of citrus zest, lemon. Taste is sour and lightly bitter. Flavors of pineapple juice, some wet oak and a touch of lemon juice. Lactic finish. Great beer.
Bottle. Hazy straw gold pour, with a white head. Grapefruit, tart sourness, juicy, melon, grassy, some tropical fruit, mild funk, and sour. Not bitter, just juicy hops and sour. Yummy.
Big Sharp almost rubbery aromas. Beautiful glowing cloudy orange with light white head. Refreshing funky sour fruity rubber flavors in the best way possible.
Pungent nose of intense hops and spur fruit. Flavor follows suit. Bitter and juicy and quite sour. Acidic feel highly carbonated. Maybe not as fine tuned as some, but very very tasty.

375 ml bottle shared, purchased at Supermarket Liquors. Bright orange appearance with a white head. Aroma of tropical fruits, citrus zest, sour notes, light earth and some funky yeast. Similar flavor, mildly sour with green and leafy hop bitterness. A light puckering feel with a tart finish. Tasty beverage.

Bottle. Cloudy yellow with a small white head. Mixed citrus on the nose with pineapple, grapefruit and passion-fruit. taste is similar to the nose. Nicely tart with a malt base that highlights a bit of bread and yeast. Decent.
Bright and yellow pour from bottle at home. Citrus fruity heaven. Aroma and taste both. Delicious. Tart but not too much

Moving to the Bay I worked with a couple of youngins who said dank about everything. I thought that word should be reserved only for weed. This is me branching out with the word. (It still doesnt mean good or hella)
Because this is a moist, wet hopped beer. Tastes like hops freshly after a long several days of rain. Wet wet wet. 
Anyways, citrus. Grapefruit, sour yeast, spices, clove, white/pink pepper, lemon, green apple, tart.

12 oz. bottle. It pours a lightly hazed yellow color with a white head that shrinks quickly. The aroma is super dank with grapefruit and hints of sliced green onion, earth and pineapple. Smells like an IPA. No hints of acid besides the pineapple. The flavor is deliciously tart with lemon, pineapple and mango. Tons of lactic acidity that draws the mouth water but stops short of being harsh. Only mild astringency, which is tough to do in a heavily hopped sour beer. Hints of funk and cut green onion underneath. More citrus and tropical fruit as it warms. Wow. Almanac really knocked this one out of the park. Awesome.

UPDATED: MAR 8, 2016 Spectacular sour citrus pine aroma in a cloudy gold pour. Brilliant balance of hoppy, tart, and sweet flavors makes this a blonde ale with a head to match the body. One of the best beers Ive had this year.

Hazy straw yellow in color... Aroma of citra hops, lemon peel, tart citrus... Flavor is grapefruit peel, lemon, citrus fruits with only mild tartness throughout... Delicious sour, excellently done

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Nice funky citrus aroma. Very complex ale with citrus, funky brett, big flavor from the wine barrels, sweet and tart. Fabulous.

375ml bottle from Binnys South Loop (Chicago, IL). Pours a hazy golden yellow hue, touch of orange and summery sun with large, cakey whitish head atop. Sizable and retentive with good lacing. Aromas are bitter and dry, firm florals and touches of citrus, tropical fruit. Some pineapple, tart and bitter with leafy green hops, lupulus bitterness, mellow bready malts. Initial is lighter bodied, a firmer bitterness and some pith with jabs of pineapple, tropical fruit. Jabs of Citra, bitterness and florals. That coolness, pineapple, mellow earth, and tart acidity. Some on point lactic appeal, yogurt and citric play meet with that firmer bitter hop appeal. The fruity Citra appeal shows a bit of life, pineapple and tropical wafts, cut through nicely at times. Solid stuff, simple but works well. The funkiness is mellow, dry and a bit bitter. Tart pineapple dominance at times. Tasty.

Light yellow, mildy cloudy, white head.  Huge lemon notes, light melon, honey.  Pleasantly tart, far from overpowering.  Quite sweet. Finishes with more sourness.  Lighter effervescent body, medium finish.  Good.

Bottle. Pours cloudy golden orange, medium off-white head, dissipates fairly slowly, good lacing. Aroma is citra, of course, passionfruit, dank leaves, light light musty funk, guava. Flavor is light tart, full on passionfruit and citra juicy hops, a very light patina of funk. Medium body. Really good. Almanacs best sour by far. Winner.

Bottle shared by Adam, thanks! Pours a hazy slight yellow with a thin white head that starts and remains at the edges. Aroma has a decent amount of funk, earthy citrus, earthy grains and a bit of a grass note. Flavor has a combination of sour citrus and grass with a light funk and grain backing.

Pours a golden yellow color with a white head. Funk, yeast, tart, lemon, orange and mango aroma and flavors. Medium light body and average carbonation with a citrus and funk finish. Could be a little more tart.

375 mL bottle poured. So happy to see this new unique offering from my favorite guys make it up here to Seattle so quick. So used to waiting months for them to show up, and for some, the waiting never ends. Open a brewpub! I want to come meet you and your incredible beer in person. Pours a bright orange tang color with a fizz ring head. Big lemon hops aroma. Flavor is hop forward as expected, and I was unsure how this was going to translate in a sour. Im not disappointed. Hop forward with a lingering orange fruit sourness. The big sour kick comes way late in the palate. I try to ignore all my previous love for Almanac with each beer rating, but it proves ineffective. These guys kick ass, and this beer is no exception. Hell yeah.
Bottle from Capitol Beer & Tap Room. Pours golden with a thick white head and a sour grapefruit aroma. There is a tart and intense citrus flavor with an interesting and unique hop finish.

Bottle to wine glass
Spruce, cat piss, yeast, grapefruit, lemon and horse blanket; quite a mix there. Hazy light yellowish amber with a thin bright white head. Mouth puckering lemon initially, but then a bit of sweetness as the sour fades and the saliva builds. Theres some wheat and yeasty funk in there and the hoppy bitterness comes through eventually. Nice one...very interesting.

Capped 375 from Capitol Beer in Sacrameno, CA. Pours hazy light gold with a slight white head. Aroma is sour - and for some reason mustard comes to mind. Med body or nearly. Flavor is sour, citrus, green melon and maybe some other fruits. Like white grapes. This is reasonably complex and quite tasty. Just a touch of wood in the finish.

375 ml bottle. Enjoyed at San Diego, CA. Pours a cloudy yellow colour with a small head. Aroma of fresh citrus, white bread and some earthiness. Flavour of heavy crisp citrusy bitterness, white grapes, mild sweetness, saltiness and red grapefruit. Medium bodied. Really crisp and citrusy.

37.5 cl bottle @ hotel room, San Diego. Aroma has citrus any bretra tones - quite interesting. Also leather shoes. Flavor has strong citrus tartness, some leathery notes and some fruity hops in the background. Also fruit candy. Rather aggressive sourness here - even a bit acidic, eats drinkability.

375ml bottle

Pours murky yellowish with a foamy white head. Aroma of tart zesty citrusy notes, lemon, grapefruit, funky yeastiness, some juicy fruits and hops. Taste is juicy, tart and sourish with loads of citrus, lemon, funky yeastiness and hops. Finish is tart and slightly sour with loads of citrus and funky yeastiness. Nice one.

375 ml bottle @ hotel room, San Diego.
Pours cloudy yellow color with a small head. Very nice aroma here, refreshing and sour lemony, some herbal notes and mild soap tones. Quite sour lemon and citrus flavor, very tangy, gooseberries and some lactic sour notes at the very end. Unique and very tasty sour brew.
3355

Pours a golden pale color, completely hazy beer that looks like pineapple juice with a one finger white head. The citra is noticeable in the smell. Pineapple jumps at the nose, with a bit of lactic acid and tropical fruits. T: Sour candy upfront, sour pineapple, green apples, with a hint of lactic acid towards the end. M: Rather full for the style, medium to high carbonation with nice punch of hoppy sourness. O: Almanac hasnt caught my eye in a while but this did. Glad I picked it up because this has to be among there best.
Bottle, Modern Times Dankfest, gold pour, white head, nose is wine, taste is hoppy, sour, citrus
